title: School Rules and Safety

vocab.definition: Something we agree to do to keep everyone safe and happy
Being careful so no one gets hurt
Being kind and caring toward others
A job you need to do

teachingNotes: Create classroom rules together. Practice emergency procedures. Role-play respectful behavior. Discuss consequences.

sample.question: Why do we have rules at school?
What should you do when you arrive at school?
How do you show respect to your teacher?
What do you do if you need help?
How should you treat school property?

truefalse.question: It's important to walk in the hallways.
expectedAny: walking keeps everyone safe in hallways

truefalse.question: You can take other people's things without asking.
Raising your hand helps the teacher know you want to talk.
expectedAny: hand raising shows you want to speak

truefalse.question: It's okay to push others in line.
Following school rules helps everyone learn better.
You should run down the stairs.
Being kind to others is a school rule.

wordProblems.question: There are 8 classroom rules and 6 hallway rules. How many school rules is that total?
In the cafeteria, 15 students followed the rules and 3 students needed reminders. How many students were in the cafeteria?
During the fire drill, the class lined up in 3 minutes. If they practiced 7 more times, how many fire drills did they do total?
The teacher gave out 12 behavior stickers. If 5 students got 2 stickers each, how many stickers did other students get?
There are 20 students in class. If 13 students remembered to raise their hands and the rest forgot, how many forgot?
During cleanup time, 9 students put away books and 6 students put away toys. How many students helped clean up?
The school has 25 safety rules. If kindergarten learned 10 rules this week, how many more do they need to learn?
